lines: I'm sorry. In order to play through this icon, you need a steady job. You may go to the WORK ICON and apply for one, then return.

In order to get part of your work finished, John Jakobs, a close work associate, mentions that you have to take a trip out of town together. He is good-looking, married, and shows every indication of being a faithful and loving father
and husband. You must decide whether or not it is best for you to go. Staying home might mean suffering a decline in your Vocational sphere.
He asks why you don't want to go with him. How do you respond?
#TELL HIM THAT YOU THINK THAT PEOPLE WOULD GET THE WRONG IDEA
#TELL HIM THAT YOU AREN'T IN THE MOOD TO TRAVEL RIGHT NOW
"I don't quite understand," he says. "How can people get the wrong idea about two people going away on some business?"
#TELL HIM THAT YOU JUST DON'T THINK IT IS RIGHT
#TELL HIM THAT THE REAL ISSUE IS NOT KNOWING HOW YOUR PRESENT PARTNER WILL HANDLE IT
Since you really have no steady relationship, I guess you think this is a good coverup for whatever your real reason is for not wanting to go.

"Suit yourself," he says. Outwardly, he seems confused about your lack of motivation to go, but he also feels angry. It seems to him that you don't trust him. He resents this. After all, he has never given you reason to think he CAN'T
He suggests that you talk it over with your partner first before you make a quick decision. Would you consider doing this?
How do you think you will approach telling him about the situation?
Your caution about relaying the news immediately makes him suspicious.

He becomes very jealous. The questions begin to flow fast and furious: "Who is this guy?" "What does he look like?" "Is he married?" Now that you know his reaction to the situation, how will you handle it?
You have allowed yourself to get pushed around by your partner's jealousy.

You have not allowed yourself to get pushed around by your partner's jealousy. You go on the trip, which increases your Vocational sphere. When you return, you wonder how things will be with your partner. Oddly, upon your arrival back
in town, you are given treatment fit for a Queen! I guess your partner realized how important you are, after all.

You calmly deliver the news that there is an important out-of-town business meeting that you have to attend with a man you work with. Your calmness and poise keep your partner relaxed and unthreatened.

Even though he lets a couple of insecurities slip out in the form of teasing ("Make sure you don't run off with anyone."), he feels as comfortable as possible with the idea. Your trip turns out very successfully.
You do not possess the kind of calmness and poise needed for delivering this potentially threatening message to your partner.
Your blunt approach sounds more like a challenge than a discussion. Your partner's jealous side immediately springs to the surface.

I guess you are positive that it will cause a problem for you and your partner. If you are feeling that there are some things that you cannot even BRING UP to your partner, it may mean your relationship is strained or faltering.
After giving it some thought, you change your mind.
Since you didn't feel entirely comfortable with the idea in the first place, you are guarded and defensive during the trip. In all, the experience is a moderate success. You gain Vocationally.
You decide that this might be a terrific opportunity to gain in the Vocational area of life.
You are right on target. Your excitement about taking the trip carries over into your work. You impress a great many people. Your Vocational and Social spheres take a healthy rise! Congratulations!

You are correct. Your excitement about taking the trip carries over into your work. You impress a great many people. Social and Vocational spheres show great improvements. The person you are traveling with would like to take you to
dinner as a way of celebrating your success.
I guess you feel very strongly about not mixing business with pleasure.
The dinner passes uneventfully. The two of you exchange small talk about your work and social lives. He mentions that he misses his children on trips like this.
While the two of you sit sipping coffee after dinner, your associate looks
off into the distance and chuckles to himself.
You ask him why he is laughing. Shaking himself out of his private conversation, he looks at you and wonders why he can't have this kind of relaxed evening with his wife. He confesses that he would
love to spend "the rest of the evening in your company."
#FOLLOW THIS EPISODE TO ITS INEVITABLE CONCLUSION
The two of you spend the evening in each other's arms, lost in a world that is doomed to fade in the morning's sunlight. When you return, you must deal with the consequences of your brief affair.

John seems uneasy around you, always wondering if you will try to continue the relationship and obviously feeling very guilty about the encounter. Your work relationship with him suffers, but you will probably continue to move upward
"He didn't seem like the type," you think to yourself. You wonder if it is ever possible to have a "friendly" relationship with someone you work with.
He congratulates you on your success, and the two of you bid each other an early good night.
He sees this as an evasive answer but respects your wishes not to go. Vocationally, you decline.
